newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Greenchip plans A$30 mln portfolio sale.
newsitem.headline: Greenchip plans A$30 mln portfolio sale.

text.p: Small companies fund manager Greenchip Emerging Growth Limited said on Wednesady it planned to sell a significant portion of its investment portfolio for about A$30 million.
This will result in the company realising about A$17.44 million profit based on the purchase cost, Greenchip said.

It said the proceeds of the sale, which is subject to shareholder approval, would be distributed via a special dividend of 30 cents per share on May 30. The dividend would be be tax-free to shareholders under the national government's Pooled Development Fund legislation.

Greenchip said two industry funds, Superannuation Trust of Australia (STA) and Construction and Building Unions Superannuation Fund ("CBUS"), will each buy for A$15 million cash a portfolio of A$18 million worth of securities.

It said STA now holds about 36 percent of the existing share capital of Greenchip Emerging Growth Ltd, whilst CBUS holds about 19 percent. It said STA and CBUS have a long term commitment to the development capital sector.
A meeting of shareholders of the company is proposed to be held during the third week of April to approve the proposed sales to STA and CBUS, it said.
Greenchip said the proposed special dividend of 30 cents a share would total A$10 million, with the surplus funds to be used for additional investment in suitable emerging growth companies.
At 11.30 a.m. (0030 GMT), Greenchip shares were 25 cents up at A$1.25 with just over 68,000 shares traded.
